title: Motion from finger scrolling is insane
content:
This problem affects several apps, but is most evident, and representative, in email.

I slide my finger up/down my screen to scroll the inbox list. To my eye, the motion is perfectly along the y-axis, but of course there is always going to be an erroneous sideways (x-axis) component. 

Android takes that tiny, visibly almost imperceptible x-axis motion, exaggerates it, and uses it to toss individual emails sideways out of the list (which I have set up for delete). 

In apps like that, in contrast to, eg, photo editing, gestures are usually all x- or y-axis; it seems like there should be a threshold of sorts before a mixed-axis motion is interpreted. 

Anyone else have this issue? Or solution?
